page.description: Set the position in the file.

argument.name: Position
argument.description: The position in the file to start reading data.

page.discussion: The .SEEK() method sets the position of the file pointer to a Byte Offset (measured in bytes) in relation to the beginning of the file specified by the object pointer, . This function is used to read and write data at a particular location in a data file.

section.title: Example
section.description: This script will change four characters in the Defaults file. The old text "VAR3" will be changed to the new text "XXXX".
Read the third group of 4 characters.
section.example: file_pointer.seek(8) text = file_pointer.read(4) trace.writeln("Old value: " + text)

section.description: Write the four characters at the same position.
Read the third group of 4 characters to see the change.
section.example: file_pointer.seek(8) text = file_pointer.read(4) trace.writeln("New value: " + text) file_pointer.close()
